title: Manager and Salesman
description: Sabre's CEO wants the Scranton branch to have one manager, and Michael voluntarily steps down and lets Jim become the boss when he finds out that salespeople make more money. However, he soon comes to regret the decision.

quotes.speaker: Hotel Employee
quotes.text: [on phone] Vancouver Court Hotel, how many I help you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello Vancouver, this is Michael Scott calling from the United States of America!  I have a reservation in your fair city from February 12th to the 19th, first week of the Olympics.

quotes.speaker: Hotel Employee
quotes.text: Well, we are looking forward to having you, so, let me just pull up your information here...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okey doke.

quotes.speaker: Hotel Employee
quotes.text: Um, I don't seem to have it, sir.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [looking through Michael's email] I'm not seeing anything under "confirmation."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Could it be under "affirmation?" Cause you have thousands of those.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. [to hotel employee on phone] We're trying to look it up right now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You [i]did[/i] get the e-vite to my barbeque!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um, come on.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael...

quotes.speaker: Hotel Employee
quotes.text: Uh, sir? A lot of people are trying to get last-minute reservations at hotels here for the Olympics, but we've been fully booked for months.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I have been booked for three years, so you should have that. I've always heard that British Columbia is a very nice place, but I am not getting that from this conversation.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, I got it! Confirmation code:

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Today, Jo Bennett, the CEO from Sabre, is coming to see us here for the first time. She bought us sight unseen, like a mail-order bride, so she's gotta be kinda nervous. I mean, are we ugly? Are we smart? Are we cool? Are we too cool? Do we speak English?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Jo Bennett enters with two humongous dogs, everyone stands to welcome her except Dwight] Why hello!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: This is Michael Scott, co-regional manager of this branch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pleasure to meet you, Miss Bennett.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Oh, that's Mrs. Bennett, sweetheart. My husband and I are divorced, but I kept the "Mrs." just to piss off the new wife. Well, let's take a gander around this place.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Jo's dogs are sniffing at his crotch] These sure are pretty dogs...

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: They love a good crotch.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: They sure do.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: You should take that as a compliment!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, I do!

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: [to Dwight] Hello.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Do you always stay seated when a lady enters the room?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am treating you the same as a man, for whom I would also not stand. Unless it was the President. Or Judge Judy.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: I like that.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: This is Accounting.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hi!

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Good-looking group.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Over here is Meredith Palmer and Creed Bratton.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Another couple of heartbreakers. Who is this tall drink of sun tea?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: That is Jim Halpert, he is the co-regional manager of this office.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: [gesturing to Michael] I thought this guy was the manager?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Oh, he is. He's the co-manager, and that's the other co-manager.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Two guys doing one job? We gotta do something about that!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Got some Valentine's cards for my coworkers and my bro-workers.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [as Andy is passing her a card] No, no!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What, no candy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Valentine's Day, right around the corner. Erin and I have been on zero dates. So I got her a Valentine's Day card, but I didn't wanna seem "too eager," so I got cards for everyone in the whole office to kind of dilute it a little bit.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [throwing a card at Meredith, which skims her throat]:

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yeah, I have this thing about men cutting or threatening to cut my throat. Don't try to cut my throat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jo, I don't know how things work in Florida, which from your description sounds like a colorful, lawless swamp, but here it takes two men to do one job, where in Florida it might take one very strong woman to do such a job.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoa, whoa.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoa, whoa!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'll take over. Um, what we're doing here:

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: I'm Jolene Bennett, Jo for short. I'm a breast cancer survivor, close, personal friends with Nancy Pelosi, and Truman Capote and I slept with three of the same guys. When I was a little girl, I was terrified to fly, and now I have my own pilot's license. I am CEO of Sabre International, and I sell the best damn printers and all-in-one machines Korea can make. Pleased to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [almost running into Erin] Whoa-oh, traffic jam!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Uh-oh, traffic jam on route three!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [imitating car noises] Beep-beep! Beeooop-beep!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Beep! Twenty people dead in a pile-up!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: There's blood everywhere! Um, I got you a Valentine's card.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [opening card] Oh, you did? Aw, a bird and a dog!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, well it's Snoopy and Woodstock.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You named them?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh, Charles Schultz did. I thought it was relevant cause I got you all those birds for Christmas, remember?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Uh, yeah I do remember. [reading card] Aw, they love each other.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, look at that. They sure do. I hadn't noticed.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Wow, it smells really good too.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah! It's Roger Federer for men, I sprayed some in there.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Andy, whoa! Thank you very much!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's got pheromones in it.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: [to Angela, who's having a hard time deciding on a chair] Just choosing seats, not getting married. Chop, chop little onion!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Jo, there's books in my chair.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: That's right, darlin', now you're the proud new owner of a Sabre handbook and my autobiography. Now, you all must be in a tizzy. I can see it on your faces, I mean, what's going on now? I mean, who owns Dunder Mifflin? Right? I mean, Sabre? What's that? Some company I've never heard of? Down in Tallahassee? Where is that? Near Mars?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, we know. Texas!

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Now Dunder Mifflin has an arm's reach in all these small businesses all over the northeast. Now we're gonna take that arm, and we're gonna start selling printers.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I could manage my way around that.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: They're the easiest-to-use printers on the market.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will try to manage my excitement!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have been saying the word "manager" a lot, so whenever Jo thinks "manager" she thinks of me. Camel cigarettes did the same thing with Joe Camel by making him look like a penis. I can't even go near a cigarette now without thinking of a penis. And vise-versa.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: I think that's it. So we're all good! [many employees raise their hands] Thanks ya'll.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Jo leaves] I, uh...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [reading her Valentine's card from Andy] Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I guess Andy likes me. I never thought of him in that way. But, I guess in most romantic comedies, the guy you're supposed to be with is the one you never thought of in that way. You might have even thought he was annoying or possibly homosexual.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, check this out. According to the handbook, you could make more money as a salesman than as a manager. They have all these incentive programs. I ran your numbers from last year.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This is way more than I make now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't think I'm gonna miss being manager. You know how some people say they're not in it for the money? Well, with all due respect to this job, I think I'm definitely in it for the money. And quite honestly, the women.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, you got a second?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sure. You here to tell me that you think I would be a better manager and that you are sorry for being such a jerk?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Actually, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Exactly that. I think that you absolutely deserve the manager position more than I do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What? Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: La la la, hello Oscar!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael. Reading.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you reading?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: The Atlantic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, that is my favorite ocean! I love it! I am so happy right now. No! I can't keep it a secret any longer. Jim is stepping down to salesman, I am going to be the sole manager once again.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I should step into sales myself.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why, is there an untapped gay market?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Sabre has no caps on commissions. He can make a lot more money in sales.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: ...Where did you get that information.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Manual.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Manuel who?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, according to the manual, there is no cap on commissions. I have been hustled.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Son of a bitch. [enters conference room] Pardon me.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Oh, speak of the devil. We were just talking about you. Have a seat!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Now Jim here is thinking about taking himself out of the running for being manager.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? Aw, that is so sweet of you! But, I cannot accept, because I have been thinking about it, and I think I wanna go back to sales.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. You can take the man out of the salesman, but you can't take the sales out of salesman.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Well, I think you're both being a little too modest.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I really, really think Michael is better at being manager for so many reasons.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I think I would be bad. I would sleep in my office, and I would sexually harass people.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why would you do that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm turning myself in right now!

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: You know, Michael, you have more experience in sales and management, so I'm gonna defer to your judgment.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: I think you [to Michael] will become the salesman, and congratulations! [to Jim] You're gonna be the new manager of this branch!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Great! That's great. Congratulations. Have fun signing my commission checks, boss.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [pointing to the window in Michael's office] Oh, Michael marked his heights. He's grown!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mm!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on phone] Bobcat, this is Dragon. Listen. He's been promoted to sole manager. We've got to step this up. Meet me behind the dumpster in ninety seconds. [hangs up phone] 89... 88...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're twenty minutes late!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [walking up] Um, I was at another dumpster!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just admit you lost track of time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ryan and I have been meeting up to work on our diabolical plot against Jim. Ryan is always late for our meetings. I wish I had a lair.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Did you see Saw?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Of course I seesaw. Mose and I seesaw all the time.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, uh, the movie. Did you see the movie Saw?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, yeah. Great film. Almost as fun as going on a seesaw.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay, the reason these movies are so popular, is the element of psychological torment.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I like where you're going with this. Continue.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Could we lure him into an old warehouse or something?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have an old barn!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's kinda smelly, but that might be a plus! And then what?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: We do what they did in Saw! ... I mean, we don't kill him, obviously. I have a mask...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, that's your idea? Exactly like in the movie!? That is the most idiotic thing I have ever heard in my life!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well suggest something else then! Don't just...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He's supposed to cut his leg off? Think!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Don't just criticize my idea!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Think!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You think of something then!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Michael, I'm worried that, uh, not all your toys are gonna fit on your new desk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How is that possible?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well, in your old office there were all those ledges and extra space.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No excuses Erin, come on! Make it happen.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You know, I actually think I should get back to work. Jim asked me to do some stuff, and he's manager.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, yeah. Fine, fine. Leave it here. I have to make some sales anyway. Who should I call with my magic sales fingers? [Michael's phone rings] Michael Scott, head of sales.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] You gotta do something, man. You can't just sit there.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The new IT guy. Nick.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Nick.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think he is the key. He's very trusting, he's looking for friends, he has been given an awesome amount of power, and does not know how to wield it.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Like Frodo!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Why don't you just let me handle the Tolkien references, okay dumb jock?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well, I think he can be corrupted. Like Gollum.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Smeagol was corrupted and became Gollum.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I might start a diabolical plot against him after this one.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Who's hungry?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What is that?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: It's ants on a log. Michael would always have me bring them in at 2:30 and say "Who's hungry?"

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh. I'm fine. Thank you, though.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Do you want me to spin you in your chair and make you dizzy?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why would I wanna do that?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: It's a thinking technique. All the top executives do it. It keeps the brain moving, and a spinning brain is a working brain.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: For now, I'm just gonna go back to work here...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh sure.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] It will be a pleasure doing business with you. Thanks, bye. [hangs up phone, blows train whistle] I just got a new account for the gentleman's club in Carbondale. It is called "Curves." I went by there the other day, saw some of the women walking in. Not really my cup of tea. Actually, Kevin, you might like it!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Nice!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know, we really don't announce out loud our sales that much.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why not? It's part of the sales experience.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's not really 1992 anymore.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, okay...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [reading Andy's card] You brighten my day with the sound of your voice, you bring so much laughter and love, you're everything to me, and I was so blessed when God sent you here to me.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Geez louise.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I know, obsessed with me much?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well, everyone got one.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What did yours say?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Friends are worth sharing a doghouse with.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: It's no wonder that Andy gave Kelly such a romantic card. I can't compete with her. That girl can sing, and dance, and gets all of her clothes at the mall. And I feel like such a fool for thinking that Andy was only going after one girl, cause Andy Bernard is a playboy. And, why shouldn't he be? He's got it all.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ho-ho. There he is, the IT guy. So you discovered the break room.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: Uh, yep.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I imagine one of the best things about being an IT guy is, you get to know everyone's computer passwords.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: No, I actually don't.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Listen, I know you have to say that, but we got a little problem here. There is an employee named Jim Halpert, and he is doing some terrible things, okay? He is molesting people via the internet. And we need to stop him.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: I think that you should call the cops.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, the cops called us. So I'm gonna need you to give me the password to Jim Halpert's computer.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: I don't know what to tell you, man. I'm sorry, I just can't give out his password like that.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Nick. We could make things very, very difficult for you.

quotes.speaker: Nick
quotes.text: Are you... you threatening me?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Threatening you? No. [tries to crush an aluminum can, Dwight  crushes an apple]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is that smell? Do you smell that? What is that? Like a sulfur deposit under here?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, stop.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I'm serious, we don't have to put up... Is it the dogs?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, we don't have to deal with this. I am going to Google sulfur maps.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, it's Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, this is geological.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I sent an email out to everyone in this area that this might be a side effect to my new allergy medication I'm on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you kidding me?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And you guys are okay with this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: She sent an email, so.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I did.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [has two tissues in his nostrils] It's not cause of the smell. I'm just expecting a nosebleed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh! You scared me!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm sorry, I thought you saw me.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I didn't see you. And you were there all along. [takes papers out of copy machine] Well, I warmed it up for you so, should be good to go.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Cool, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Bye, Andy. [kisses his cheek]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: ...That was weird.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: No it ain't. We all saw the Valentine you gave her.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't even know what that card said.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Believe me, if I got that card? We'd be in the bathroom doin' it right... now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know, it's funny. I used to stand in here and wish I was out there. Now I'm out there, and I wish I was in here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, the grass is always greener.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. Except there's no grass out there. It's just a farty dirt patch.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, it's what you wanted.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I really need my job back. We made a terrible mistake here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: For the record, I fought this. Alright? And now, I'm not really sure what we do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We make a poster that says "Happy Opposite Day!" and she sees it on the way out... Nah, that's stupid. Ugh! I wish we had one of those amnesia flashlights from Men in Black.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, what was that movie where their boss was within earshot and they could've just gone and talked to her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Lethal Weapon?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's it. I think we should do it the Lethal Weapon way.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: You two are grown-ass men. What do I have to do, fire you and get two people in here who don't need so much management?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What? What I'm saying...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael's saying he's better at being manager, and I agree, cause he's a better people person, weirdly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And weirdly I'm a good dog person, right guys? [dogs go to him] See? They love me.

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: Fine. I don't care which one of you does which job, just stop meeting with me to talk about it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright!

quotes.speaker: Jo
quotes.text: [cell phone rings] Oh, I gotta take this. Yep. Uh, finish walking my dogs for me. And don't ride 'em. Lotta people try to ride 'em.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Erin leaves room] Excuse me? Everyone? Please check your emails, I just sent you the following message:

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah, I guess Andy never liked Kelly. How about that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, it smells good in here.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Sure does! Okay, we have your space heater, your humidifier, your dehumidifier, your fan, your foot fan, and your food dehydrator.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Erin, what about my keyboard? [Erin hits a button on an electronic keyboard, playing a beat] Aw, so good to be home. How about a little Bosa Nova?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh! [hits another key, they awkwardly dance together]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [gesturing to Michael dancing in his office] He looks happy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, well, well. Hm. Boss for, what was it? Oh, four and a half hours? New record. Low. Previous record? Henry Rosston. Boss for nine years, four months. And he only left because he had family matters to attend to and he [Jim dunks Dwight's tie in his coffee cup, Pam smiles] what? Michael!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [entering elevator with Ryan] I can't help but think that something we did made this possible.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Jim dug his own grave, but maybe we provided the shovel.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh temp, I like that. I'm going to engrave that into a piece of wood. Care to celebrate with a drink?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I would love to. [elevator doors close, then reopen in the lobby] Why not?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Because! Martini bars are pretentious. No thank you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well, I'm sorry that I don't want farm boy swill like you do, you know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It is not "farm boy swill," I will show you. It is beet Vodka and it is delicious.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I am not interested in anything I have to make myself!
